file_content.text: You just head up to Meridian Hall and send me the signal and I'll make sure you get your groundquake.
I should have the whole thing in place by the time you reach Meridian Hall, but you might want to give me a few just in case.
Look, we're both businessmen, right? Consider my help an investment in your operations.
What's so wrong about a businessman seeking a return on his investment? Your boss saves money in the long run.
All right, Madel, you win this time. But one day you're going to reach too deep into the wrong pockets.
Yeah, sure. It's been a pleasure doing business with you.
Sorry to keep you waiting, Sith, but business is business. What do you need that Gord Madel can help you with?
I need to create a groundquake.
A miracle.
I want to shake Nar Shaddaa at its very foundation!
Glory!
Work with me or else.
Uh, sure. Yeah. Gord Madel lives to be of service. Why don't you fill me in on the details first?
So let me get this straight--you want me to set off a giant groundquake underneath Meridian Hall?
No. No, that's crazy. I'd need to blow up the pipes to do that. I can't. It'd get me fired.
What does taking bribes from a gangster get you? Promoted?
You're hardly a model worker.
That's just good business. Everyone on Nar Shaddaa lines their pockets with a little supplementary income.
Don't fight me.
Look, Sith, I don't want trouble, okay? But I got a family to think of.
Taking bribes is one thing, but you're asking me to damage public property.
It's so much more fun for me when you refuse.
Good answer. [Shock him]
Aaagh!
Please, don't! I don't want trouble, but I got a family to think of.
What do you think happens to me when those pipes get damaged and the gang lords of Nar Shaddaa blame me? What happens to my family?
I'm sure they'll understand.
[Force Persuade] Nothing.
Yes--they'll understand. After all, when a Sith asks for a groundquake, who am I to refuse?
Take your family to the Strell House. My servants will protect you.
Don't worry.
Look, I--what? If I do this, I will destroy my livelihood, and make enemies of every major ganglord on Nar Shaddaa!
And in exchange, you are willing to let me live in your house? You're a poor businessman, Sith.
My cult takes in a great deal of money. You'll be set up for life.
I'll hire you.
Argh, all right. I'll do it. Your terms are good, and I'm not desperate enough to cross a Sith.
You will set up the groundquake.
[Force Persuade] Just do it.
I will set up the groundquake.
It'll take some time to set up, but that should give you time to get to Meridian Hall. Take this signaling device and signal me when you want the quake.
Oh and take this as well--it could come in handy.
You don't say things like that to a Sith.
Don't insult me. [Shock him]
Do you still hope to win?
Not this. [Shock him]
Aaagh!
All right. No more. No more. I'll--I'll do it. Just please, no more.
It'll take some time to get everything in place, but take this signaling device. When you want your groundquake, signal me.
You better follow through on this.
Don't try anything fancy.
And I'm counting on you to keep your promise. Protection for me and my family.
Don't worry, I have a very well-developed instinct for self-preservation.
You've done well.
A signaling device! You shouldn't have!
Oh boy!
Yeah, I'm beginning to wonder about that myself.
